data_facts_with_vis_data_meta.paragraph: Even so, Thomas says gold is likely to break more records this year. Goldman Sachs Research predicts gold will rise to $3,700 a troy ounce by the end of 2025 (from $3,220 on May 15) as central banks buy many tonnes of the precious metal every month.

facts.fact_content: Goldman Sachs Research predicts gold will rise to $3,700 a troy ounce by the end of 2025.
Gold was $3,220 a troy ounce on May 15.

article_meta_data.title: Goldman Sachs Research’s gold price prediction 2025

all_paragraphs.paragraph: Even so, Thomas says gold is likely to break more records this year. Goldman Sachs Research predicts gold will rise to $3,700 a troy ounce by the end of 2025 (from $3,220 on May 15) as central banks buy many tonnes of the precious metal every month.
In the event of a recession,Goldman Sachs Researchforecasts that gold could rise to as much as $3,880 a troy ounce.
For example, global gold ETF holdings are worth only about 1% of outstanding US Treasuries and 0.5% of the S&P500 market cap.

all_facts.fact_content: Goldman Sachs Research predicts gold will rise to $3,700 a troy ounce by the end of 2025.
Gold was $3,220 a troy ounce on May 15.
Gold could rise to as much as $3,880 a troy ounce in the event of a recession.
Global gold ETF holdings are worth about 1% of outstanding US Treasuries.
Global gold ETF holdings are worth 0.5% of the S&P500 market cap.

Gold was $3,220 a troy ounce on May 15.
Gold could rise to as much as $3,880 a troy ounce in the event of a recession.
Global gold ETF holdings are worth about 1% of outstanding US Treasuries.
Global gold ETF holdings are worth 0.5% of the S&P500 market cap.
